intro: [WRONG START] Achimenses superba, commonly known as the flame violet, is a striking tropical plant native to Mexico and Central America. It is characterized by its vibrant, tubular flowers that range from red to orange, often with a contrasting dark throat. The plant features heart-shaped, velvety leaves that are typically green with a slight purple tinge. It thrives in warm, humid environments and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Achimenes superba is often cultivated as a decorative plant due to its ornamental value and unique floral display.
